result.execSummary:
The defendant Ramone Montez Bridges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 20CF1156 and consecutive to 90 day jail sentence in 20CF1156

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramone Montez Bridges

records.addlTxt: 2:02 PM Defendant Ramone Montez Bridges in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen in court for Ramone Montez Bridges.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court finds defendant guilty. Count 1 dismissed and read in. Defendant waives his right to a presentence investigation. Court orders 5 years probation concurrent with 20CF1156 and consecutive to jail sentence in 20CF1156, costs due within 60 days and sentence credit 77 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
